bibl.title: Report: Statistics of Births, Marriages, Deaths, Immigration and Yellow Fever From 1890 to 1899, by John G. Davis, [1899]

div1.p: In addition to the topics mentioned in the title, this report by Davis, the Chief Sanitary Officer in Havana, Cuba, includes a sanitary report and the number of cases of infectious diseases. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Report: Statistics of Births, Marriages, Deaths, Immigration and Yellow Fever From 1890 to 1899, by John G. Davis, [1899]
div1.p:
File
FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF HAVANA
HAVANA, CUBA.

STATISTICS OF BIRTHS.
Marriages, Deaths,
Immigration and Yellow Fever
From 1890 to 1899

Major John G. Davis.
Surgeon, U. S. V.
Chief Sanitary Officer.

row.cell: Apparent Excess of Deaths over Births

div1.p:
REPORT OF ARRIVALS AND DEPARTURES
PORT OF HAVANA 1899.
These figures do not include U. S. or Spanish Troops.

row.cell: Number of times sewer and catch basins cleaned and disinfected
Number of new water service to private houses
Number of times Public Urinals in Havana cleaned and disinfected

Average Gallons of Electrozone applied daily to streets, sewers and
houses
Number of lineal feet of old sewers cleaned and disinfected
Area of streets cleaned daily; square meters
Area of Pavement renewed; square meters
Number of houses in which plumbing modifications have been made
Cart loads of refuse material removed from April to December 140.511.
Increasing from 10.808 in April to 14.420 in December 1899.

div1.p:
CONTAGIOUS AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES REPORTED
OTHER THAN YELLOW FEVER
CASES OF AND DEATHS FROM YELLOW FEVER DURING YEAR 1899
